# How to sponsor a worker

How to sponsor a worker
Page Content

​​​​​​​​​This applies to employers who want to start sponsoring a skilled worker, or wish to take over an existing sponsorship. It provides a general overview of the process.

​​​​​​​​​This applies to employers who want to start sponsoring a skilled worker, or wish to take over an existing sponsorship. It provides a general overview of the process.

The specific requirements, process and documents you need to provide depends on the chosenvisa option.

The specific requirements, process and documents you need to provide depends on the chosen
visa option
.

Step 1

Step 1
You need to show that you can't find a person in Australia to fill your vacancy

In your application you will need provide evidence of yourlabour market testingand that it meets the labour market testing requirements. A small number of occupations are exempt from this requirement. For more information seelabour market testing.

In your application you will need provide evidence of your
labour market testing
and that it meets the labour market testing requirements. A small number of occupations are exempt from this requirement. For more information see
labour market testing
.

Step 2

Step 2
The occupation you want must be on the list of eligible skilled occupations

The occupation you want to sponsor a skilled worker for, must be on the list of eligible skilled occupations.

The occupation you want to sponsor a skilled worker for, must be on the list of eligible skilled occupations.

The government consults with a wide range of people and organisations to decide on what skills Australia needs. See the eligibleskilled occupations list.

The government consults with a wide range of people and organisations to decide on what skills Australia needs. See the eligible
skilled occupations list
.

If the occupation you need is not on the list of eligible skilled occupations you might be able to negotiate alabour agreement.

If the occupation you need is not on the list of eligible skilled occupations you might be able to negotiate a
labour agreement
.

Certain visa options and streams are also available for more highly paid applicants with specialist skills or exceptional talents.

Certain visa options and streams are also available for more highly paid applicants with specialist skills or exceptional talents.

The skilled worker may be asked to provide evidence that they have the recognised qualifications, skills and/or work experience.

The skilled worker may be asked to provide evidence that they have the recognised qualifications, skills and/or work experience.

You must pay the skilled worker no less than the applicable market salary rate for the occupation and in accordance with the requirements of the visa or the nomination.

You must pay the skilled worker no less than the applicable market salary rate for the occupation and in accordance with the requirements of the visa or the nomination.

The nominated occupation will determine the visa options or stream for which the employee can apply.

The nominated occupation will determine the visa options or stream for which the employee can apply.

Step 3

Step 3
Find a visa that suits the employee and your needs

Use VEVO to check the skilled workerseligibility for this visa.

Use VEVO to check the skilled workers
eligibility for this visa.

Step 4

Step 4
Check that you and your business are eligible to sponsor

See alsovisa options for sponsored skilled workers..

See also
visa options for sponsored skilled workers.
.

Step 5

Step 5
Apply to become a sponsor

You will need to become anapproved sponsorand/ornominatorto sponsor a skilled worker.

You will need to become an
approved sponsor
and/or
nominator
to sponsor a skilled worker.

You may also apply to be anaccredited sponsordepending on the visa you choose.

You may also apply to be an
accredited sponsor
depending on the visa you choose.

If you are accredited you will receive priority processing, seesponsoring skilled workers accredited sponsorfor more information on accredited sponsorships.

If you are accredited you will receive priority processing, see
sponsoring skilled workers accredited sponsor
for more information on accredited sponsorships.

For more information seeBecoming a sponsorornominator.

For more information see
Becoming a sponsor
or
nominator.

Step 6

Step 6
Nominate the occupation

Nominate the skilled worker's occupation or position as required by the visa type chosen, and include the details of the person to fill that position

Nominate the skilled worker's occupation or position as required by the visa type chosen, and include the details of the person to fill that position

Nominate an employeefor a position/occupation in your organisation.

Nominate an employee
for a position/occupation in your organisation.

In most cases, the position for the visa you have chosen must be on the relevantskilled occupation list.

In most cases, the position for the visa you have chosen must be on the relevant
skilled occupation list
.

Step 7

Step 7
Complete the visa application

This step is the responsibility of the skilled worker (nominee). You should still check that the nominee meets the visa eligibility criteria.

This step is the responsibility of the skilled worker (nominee). You should still check that the nominee meets the visa eligibility criteria.

Some nominees need a skills assessment from the correctassessing authorityfor their chosen occupation/ position.

Some nominees need a skills assessment from the correct
assessing authority
for their chosen occupation/ position.

This assessment is part of the visa application process.

This assessment is part of the visa application process.

#### What to do if you have taken over a business with Employer Sponsored visa holders

What to do if you have taken over a business with Employer Sponsored visa holders

If you are taking over a sponsorship and your employees are SID, TSS or subclass 457 visa holders, you will need to:

If you are taking over a sponsorship and your employees are SID, TSS or subclass 457 visa holders, you will need to:
- apply to become an approved sponsor for that business and

apply to become an approved sponsor for that business and

apply to become an approved sponsor for that business and
- lodge a new nomination application for each visa holder.

lodge a new nomination application for each visa holder.

lodge a new nomination application for each visa holder.

The visa holder does not need to submit a new visa application unless:

The visa holder does not need to submit a new visa application unless:
- their visa is about to cease or

their visa is about to cease or

their visa is about to cease or
- you intend to employ the visa holder in a different nominated occupation.

you intend to employ the visa holder in a different nominated occupation.

you intend to employ the visa holder in a different nominated occupation.
